title: Annual Compliance for One Person Company

sections.heading: Annual OPC Compliance: Simple, Cheap, and All Online
content: Even if you don't have a business or make any money, you still have to follow the rules for running a One Person Company (OPC) every year.
If you miss a due date, you could face big fines and legal problems.
Let our professionals handle your OPC annual compliance so you can concentrate on expanding your business.

sections.heading: What does OPC annual compliance mean?
content: Every OPC that is registered in India must file:

points: ROC yearly returns
Statements of finances
Tax returns for income

sections.heading: Rules
content: No matter how much business you do or how much money you make, you have to follow these rules every year.

sections.heading: Mandatory OPC Annual Filings & Due Dates

rows: Within 180 days of the end of FY

sections.heading: Note
content: Please note that OPC does not have to hold an annual general meeting.

points: Keeping books of accounts up to date
Choosing an auditor
Filing even for NIL turnover OPC
Following the Companies Act

sections.heading: Note 2
content: We take care of everything correctly and on time.

sections.heading: Fees and Penalties for Being Late

points: ₹100 late fee for ROC filings every day
There is no limit on the penalty
The Director DIN may be turned off
Delays can cost a lot

list.title: Is it required for OPC with no business to comply every year?
points: Yes. Even NIL turnover OPCs have to file annual compliance reports.

list.title: Does OPC have to hold an AGM?
points: No. OPCs don't have to hold an AGM.

list.title: Is it necessary for OPC to have an audit?
points: Yes. Statutory audits are required no matter how much money a company makes.

list.title: Is GST part of OPC compliance?
points: If the OPC is GST registered, GST compliance is separate and only applies to it.

list.title: Do you have yearly compliance packages?
points: Yes. We offer affordable OPC compliance packages that cover everything.
